An array of responses, one for each activity that was performed by the campaign.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ActivitiesResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Activity
member.summary: Specifies the configuration and other settings for an activity in a journey.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Activity.ConditionalSplit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConditionalSplit.
The settings for a yes/no split activity. This type of activity sends participants down one of two paths in a journey, based on conditions that you specify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Activity.ContactCenter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContactCenter.
The settings for a connect activity. This type of activity initiates a contact center call to participants.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Activity.CUSTOM
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CUSTOM.
The settings for a custom message activity. This type of activity calls an AWS Lambda function or web hook that sends messages to participants.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Activity.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The custom description of the activity.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Activity.EMAIL
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EMAIL.
The settings for an email activity. This type of activity sends an email message to participants.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Activity.Holdout
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Holdout.
The settings for a holdout activity. This type of activity stops a journey for a specified percentage of participants.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Activity.MultiCondition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MultiCondition.
The settings for a multivariate split activity. This type of activity sends participants down one of as many as five paths (including a default Else path) in a journey, based on conditions that you specify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Activity.PUSH
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PUSH.
The settings for a push notification activity. This type of activity sends a push notification to participants.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Activity.RandomSplit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RandomSplit.
The settings for a random split activity. This type of activity randomly sends specified percentages of participants down one of as many as five paths in a journey, based on conditions that you specify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Activity.SMS
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SMS.
The settings for an SMS activity. This type of activity sends a text message to participants.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Activity.Wait
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Wait.
The settings for a wait activity. This type of activity waits for a certain amount of time or until a specific date and time before moving participants to the next activity in a journey.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ADMMessage
member.summary: Specifies the settings for a one-time message that's sent directly to an endpoint through the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging) channel.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ADMMessage.Action
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Action.
The action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of the Android platform.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ADMMessage.Body
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Body.
The body of the notification message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ADMMessage.ConsolidationKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConsolidationKey.
An arbitrary string that indicates that multiple messages are logically the same and that Amazon Device Messaging (ADM) can drop previously enqueued messages in favor of this message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ADMMessage.Data
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Data.
The JSON data payload to use for the push notification, if the notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ADMMessage.ExpiresAfter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExpiresAfter.
The amount of time, in seconds, that ADM should store the message if the recipient's device is offline. Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the expiresAfter parameter when it sends the notification message to ADM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ADMMessage.IconReference
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IconReference.
The icon image name of the asset saved in your app.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ADMMessage.ImageIconUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageIconUrl.
The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of the push notification.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ADMMessage.ImageUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageUrl.
The URL of an image to display in the push notification.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ADMMessage.MD5
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MD5.
The base64-encoded, MD5 checksum of the value specified by the Data property. ADM uses the MD5 value to verify the integrity of the data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ADMMessage.RawContent
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RawContent.
The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ADMMessage.SilentPush
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SilentPush.
Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification, which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as updating an app's configuration or supporting phone home functionality.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ADMMessage.SmallImageIconUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SmallImageIconUrl.
The URL of the small icon image to display in the status bar and the content view of the push notification.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ADMMessage.Sound
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Sound.
The sound to play when the recipient receives the push notification. You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a sound resource that's bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound file must reside in /res/raw/.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ADMMessage.Substitutions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Substitutions.
The default message variables to use in the notification message. You can override the default variables with individual address variables.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ADMMessage.Title
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Title.
The title to display above the notification message on the recipient's device.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ADMMessage.Url
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Url.
The URL to open in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.

member.summary:

The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for a push notification that's based on the message template. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message template.

member.summary:

The URL of the small icon image to display in the status bar and the content view of a push notification that's based on the message template.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Sound.
The sound to play when a recipient receives a push notification that's based on the message template. You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a sound resource that's bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound file must reside in /res/raw/.

The title to use in a push notification that's based on the message template. This title appears above the notification message on a recipient's device.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSMessage
member.summary: Specifies the settings for a one-time message that's sent directly to an endpoint through the APNs (Apple Push Notification service) channel.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSMessage.Action
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Action.
The action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of the iOS platform.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSMessage.APNSPushType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property APNSPushType.
The type of push notification to send. Valid values are:
alert - For a standard notification that's displayed on recipients' devices and prompts a recipient to interact with the notification.
background - For a silent notification that delivers content in the background and isn't displayed on recipients' devices.
complication - For a notification that contains update information for an app’s complication timeline.
fileprovider - For a notification that signals changes to a File Provider extension.
mdm - For a notification that tells managed devices to contact the MDM server.
voip - For a notification that provides information about an incoming VoIP call.
Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-push-type request header when it sends the notification message to APNs. If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint sets the value to alert or background automatically, based on the value that you specify for the SilentPush or RawContent property of the message.
For more information about the apns-push-type request header, see Sending Notification Requests to APNs on the Apple Developer website.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSMessage.Badge
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Badge.
The key that indicates whether and how to modify the badge of your app's icon when the recipient receives the push notification. If this key isn't included in the dictionary, the badge doesn't change. To remove the badge, set this value to 0.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSMessage.Body
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Body.
The body of the notification message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSMessage.Category
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Category.
The key that indicates the notification type for the push notification. This key is a value that's defined by the identifier property of one of your app's registered categories.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSMessage.CollapseId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CollapseId.
An arbitrary identifier that, if assigned to multiple messages, APNs uses to coalesce the messages into a single push notification instead of delivering each message individually. This value can't exceed 64 bytes.
Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-collapse-id request header when it sends the notification message to APNs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSMessage.Data
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Data.
The JSON payload to use for a silent push notification. This payload is added to the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSMessage.MediaUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MediaUrl.
The URL of an image or video to display in the push notification.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSMessage.PreferredAuthenticationMethod
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PreferredAuthenticationMethod.
The authentication method that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use when authenticating with APNs, CERTIFICATE or TOKEN.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSMessage.Priority
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Priority.
para>5 - Low priority, the notification might be delayed, delivered as part of a group, or throttled.
/listitem>
10 - High priority, the notification is sent immediately. This is the default value. A high priority notification should trigger an alert, play a sound, or badge your app's icon on the recipient's device.
/para>
Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-priority request header when it sends the notification message to APNs.
The equivalent values for Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), are normal, for 5, and high, for 10. If you specify an FCM value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint accepts and converts the value to the corresponding APNs value.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSMessage.RawContent
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RawContent.
The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message.
If you specify the raw content of an APNs push notification, the message payload has to include the content-available key. The value of the content-available key has to be an integer, and can only be 0 or 1. If you're sending a standard notification, set the value of content-available to 0. If you're sending a silent (background) notification, set the value of content-available to 1. Additionally, silent notification payloads can't include the alert, badge, or sound keys. For more information, see Generating a Remote Notification and Pushing Background Updates to Your App on the Apple Developer website.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSMessage.SilentPush
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SilentPush.
Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification. A silent (or background) push notification isn't displayed on recipients' devices. You can use silent push notifications to make small updates to your app, or to display messages in an in-app message center.
Amazon Pinpoint uses this property to determine the correct value for the apns-push-type request header when it sends the notification message to APNs. If you specify a value of true for this property, Amazon Pinpoint sets the value for the apns-push-type header field to background.
If you specify the raw content of an APNs push notification, the message payload has to include the content-available key. For silent (background) notifications, set the value of content-available to 1. Additionally, the message payload for a silent notification can't include the alert, badge, or sound keys. For more information, see Generating a Remote Notification and Pushing Background Updates to Your App on the Apple Developer website.
Apple has indicated that they will throttle "excessive" background notifications based on current traffic volumes. To prevent your notifications being throttled, Apple recommends that you send no more than 3 silent push notifications to each recipient per hour.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSMessage.Sound
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Sound.
The key for the sound to play when the recipient receives the push notification. The value for this key is the name of a sound file in your app's main bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your app's data container. If the sound file can't be found or you specify default for the value, the system plays the default alert sound.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSMessage.Substitutions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Substitutions.
The default message variables to use in the notification message. You can override these default variables with individual address variables.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSMessage.ThreadId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ThreadId.
The key that represents your app-specific identifier for grouping notifications. If you provide a Notification Content app extension, you can use this value to group your notifications together.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSMessage.TimeToLive
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimeToLive.
The amount of time, in seconds, that APNs should store and attempt to deliver the push notification, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the first time. If this value is 0, APNs treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service doesn't store or try to deliver the notification again.
Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-expiration request header when it sends the notification message to APNs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSMessage.Title
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Title.
The title to display above the notification message on the recipient's device.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSMessage.Url
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Url.
The URL to open in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSPushNotificationTemplate
member.summary: Specifies channel-specific content and settings for a message template that can be used in push notifications that are sent through the APNs (Apple Push Notification service) channel.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSPushNotificationTemplate.Action
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Action.
The action to occur if a recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message template. Valid values are:
OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of the iOS platform.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSPushNotificationTemplate.Body
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Body.
The message body to use in push notifications that are based on the message template.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSPushNotificationTemplate.MediaUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MediaUrl.
The URL of an image or video to display in push notifications that are based on the message template.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSPushNotificationTemplate.RawContent
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RawContent.
The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for push notifications that are based on the message template. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message template.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSPushNotificationTemplate.Sound
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Sound.
The key for the sound to play when the recipient receives a push notification that's based on the message template. The value for this key is the name of a sound file in your app's main bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your app's data container. If the sound file can't be found or you specify default for the value, the system plays the default alert sound.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSPushNotificationTemplate.Title
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Title.
The title to use in push notifications that are based on the message template. This title appears above the notification message on a recipient's device.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.APNSPushNotificationTemplate.Url
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Url.
The URL to open in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message template and the value of the Action property is URL.

member.summary:

This value describes the associated metric and consists of two or more terms, which are comprised of lowercase alphanumeric characters, separated by a hyphen. For a list of possible values, see the Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide.

member.summary: Provides information about an application, including the default settings for an application.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ApplicationSettingsResource.ApplicationId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ApplicationId.
The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the Project ID on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ApplicationSettingsResource.CampaignHook
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CampaignHook.
The settings for the AWS Lambda function to invoke by default as a code hook for campaigns in the application. You can use this hook to customize segments that are used by campaigns in the application.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ApplicationSettingsResource.LastModifiedDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastModifiedDate.
The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the application's settings were last modified.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ApplicationSettingsResource.Limits
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Limits.
The default sending limits for campaigns in the application.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ApplicationSettingsResource.QuietTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QuietTime.
The default quiet time for campaigns in the application. Quiet time is a specific time range when messages aren't sent to endpoints, if all the following conditions are met:
The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set to a valid value.
The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time settings).
The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time settings).
If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will receive messages from a campaign or journey, even if quiet time is enabled.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.BaiduMessage
member.summary: Specifies the settings for a one-time message that's sent directly to an endpoint through the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push) channel.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.BaiduMessage.Action
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Action.
The action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of the Android platform.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.BaiduMessage.Body
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Body.
The body of the notification message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.BaiduMessage.Data
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Data.
The JSON data payload to use for the push notification, if the notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.BaiduMessage.IconReference
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IconReference.
The icon image name of the asset saved in your app.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.BaiduMessage.ImageIconUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageIconUrl.
The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of the push notification.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.BaiduMessage.ImageUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageUrl.
The URL of an image to display in the push notification.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.BaiduMessage.RawContent
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RawContent.
The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.BaiduMessage.SilentPush
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SilentPush.
Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification, which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as updating an app's configuration or supporting phone home functionality.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.BaiduMessage.SmallImageIconUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SmallImageIconUrl.
The URL of the small icon image to display in the status bar and the content view of the push notification.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.BaiduMessage.Sound
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Sound.
The sound to play when the recipient receives the push notification. You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a sound resource that's bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound file must reside in /res/raw/.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.BaiduMessage.Substitutions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Substitutions.
The default message variables to use in the notification message. You can override the default variables with individual address variables.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.BaiduMessage.TimeToLive
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimeToLive.
The amount of time, in seconds, that the Baidu Cloud Push service should store the message if the recipient's device is offline. The default value and maximum supported time is 604,800 seconds (7 days).

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.BaiduMessage.Title
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Title.
The title to display above the notification message on the recipient's device.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.BaiduMessage.Url
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Url.
The URL to open in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse.KpiName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KpiName.
The name of the metric, also referred to as a key performance indicator (KPI), that the data was retrieved for. This value describes the associated metric and consists of two or more terms, which are comprised of lowercase alphanumeric characters, separated by a hyphen. For a list of possible values, see the Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse.KpiResult
member.summary:

member.summary:

The first date and time of the date range that was used to filter the query results, in extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is inclusive.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CampaignEventFilter.FilterType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterType.
The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent. Valid values are: SYSTEM, sends the campaign when a system event occurs; and, ENDPOINT, sends the campaign when an endpoint event (Events resource) occurs.

member.summary: Specifies settings for invoking an AWS Lambda function that customizes a segment for a campaign.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CampaignHook.LambdaFunctionName
member.summary:

The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function that Amazon Pinpoint invokes to customize a segment for a campaign.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CampaignHook.Mode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Mode.
The mode that Amazon Pinpoint uses to invoke the AWS Lambda function. Possible values are:
FILTER - Invoke the function to customize the segment that's used by a campaign.
DELIVERY - (Deprecated) Previously, invoked the function to send a campaign through a custom channel. This functionality is not supported anymore. To send a campaign through a custom channel, use the CustomDeliveryConfiguration and CampaignCustomMessage objects of the campaign.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CampaignHook.WebUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WebUrl.
The web URL that Amazon Pinpoint calls to invoke the AWS Lambda function over HTTPS.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CampaignLimits
member.summary: For a campaign, specifies limits on the messages that the campaign can send. For an application, specifies the default limits for messages that campaigns in the application can send.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CampaignLimits.Daily
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Daily.
The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single endpoint during a 24-hour period. For an application, this value specifies the default limit for the number of messages that campaigns and journeys can send to a single endpoint during a 24-hour period. The maximum value is 100.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CampaignLimits.MaximumDuration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaximumDuration.
The maximum amount of time, in seconds, that a campaign can attempt to deliver a message after the scheduled start time for the campaign. The minimum value is 60 seconds.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CampaignLimits.MessagesPerSecond
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MessagesPerSecond.
The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send each second. For an application, this value specifies the default limit for the number of messages that campaigns can send each second. The minimum value is 50. The maximum value is 20,000.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CampaignLimits.Session
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Session.
The maximum total number of messages that the campaign can send per user session.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CampaignLimits.Total
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Total.
The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single endpoint during the course of the campaign. If a campaign recurs, this setting applies to all runs of the campaign. The maximum value is 100.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Body.
The body of the SMS message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CampaignSmsMessage.EntityId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EntityId.
The entity ID or Principal Entity (PE) id received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in your country.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CampaignSmsMessage.MessageType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MessageType.
The SMS message type. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages that are critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and PROMOTIONAL (for messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive, such as marketing messages).

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CampaignSmsMessage.OriginationNumber
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OriginationNumber.
The long code to send the SMS message from. This value should be one of the dedicated long codes that's assigned to your AWS account. Although it isn't required, we recommend that you specify the long code using an E.164 format to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of the message. For example, +12065550100.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CampaignSmsMessage.SenderId
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CampaignState.CampaignStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CampaignStatus.
The current status of the campaign, or the current status of a treatment that belongs to an A/B test campaign.
If a campaign uses A/B testing, the campaign has a status of COMPLETED only if all campaign treatments have a status of COMPLETED. If you delete the segment that's associated with a campaign, the campaign fails and has a status of DELETED.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Condition
member.summary: Specifies the conditions to evaluate for an activity in a journey, and how to evaluate those conditions.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Condition.Conditions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Conditions.
The conditions to evaluate for the activity.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Condition.Operator
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Operator.
Specifies how to handle multiple conditions for the activity. For example, if you specify two conditions for an activity, whether both or only one of the conditions must be met for the activity to be performed.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ConditionalSplitActivity
member.summary:
Specifies the settings for a yes/no split activity in a journey. This type of activity sends participants down one of two paths in a journey, based on conditions that you specify.
To create yes/no split activities that send participants down different paths based on push notification events (such as Open or Received events), your mobile app has to specify the User ID and Endpoint ID values. For more information, see Integrating Amazon Pinpoint with your application in the Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ConditionalSplitActivity.Condition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Condition.
The conditions that define the paths for the activity, and the relationship between the conditions.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ConditionalSplitActivity.EvaluationWaitTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EvaluationWaitTime.
The amount of time to wait before determining whether the conditions are met, or the date and time when Amazon Pinpoint determines whether the conditions are met.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ConditionalSplitActivity.FalseActivity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FalseActivity.
The unique identifier for the activity to perform if the conditions aren't met.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ConditionalSplitActivity.TrueActivity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TrueActivity.
The unique identifier for the activity to perform if the conditions are met.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CreateRecommenderConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies Amazon Pinpoint configuration settings for retrieving and processing recommendation data from a recommender model.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CreateRecommenderConfiguration.Attributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attributes.
A map of key-value pairs that defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user attributes, depending on the value for the RecommendationProviderIdType property. Each of these attributes temporarily stores a recommended item that's retrieved from the recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda function for additional processing. Each attribute can be used as a message variable in a message template.
In the map, the key is the name of a custom attribute and the value is a custom display name for that attribute. The display name appears in the Attribute finder of the template editor on the Amazon Pinpoint console. The following restrictions apply to these names:
An attribute name must start with a letter or number and it can contain up to 50 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Attribute names are case sensitive and must be unique.
An attribute display name must start with a letter or number and it can contain up to 25 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).
This object is required if the configuration invokes an AWS Lambda function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to process recommendation data. Otherwise, don't include this object in your request.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CreateRecommenderConfiguration.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A custom description of the configuration for the recommender model. The description can contain up to 128 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces, or the following symbols: _ ; () , ‐.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CreateRecommenderConfiguration.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
A custom name of the configuration for the recommender model. The name must start with a letter or number and it can contain up to 128 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CreateRecommenderConfiguration.RecommendationProviderIdType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommendationProviderIdType.
The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID to associate with unique user IDs in the recommender model. This value enables the model to use attribute and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or user in an Amazon Pinpoint application. Valid values are:
PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Associate each user in the model with a particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.
PINPOINT_USER_ID - Associate each user in the model with a particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If you specify this value, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify both a user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages won’t be sent to the user's endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CreateRecommenderConfiguration.RecommendationProviderRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommendationProviderRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve recommendation data from the recommender model.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CreateRecommenderConfiguration.RecommendationProviderUri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommendationProviderUri.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model to retrieve recommendation data from. This value must match the ARN of an Amazon Personalize campaign.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CreateRecommenderConfiguration.RecommendationsDisplayName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommendationsDisplayName.
A custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the RecommendationProviderIdType property. This value is required if the configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of recommendation data.
This name appears in the Attribute finder of the template editor on the Amazon Pinpoint console. The name can contain up to 25 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). These restrictions don't apply to attribute values.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CreateRecommenderConfiguration.RecommendationsPerMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommendationsPerMessage.
The number of recommended items to retrieve from the model for each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the RecommendationProviderIdType property. This number determines how many recommended items are available for use in message variables. The minimum value is 1. The maximum value is 5. The default value is 5.
To use multiple recommended items and custom attributes with message variables, you have to use an AWS Lambda function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of recommendation data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CreateRecommenderConfiguration.RecommendationTransformerUri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommendationTransformerUri.
The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function to invoke for additional processing of recommendation data that's retrieved from the recommender model.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CustomDeliveryConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies the delivery configuration settings for sending a campaign or campaign treatment through a custom channel. This object is required if you use the CampaignCustomMessage object to define the message to send for the campaign or campaign treatment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CustomDeliveryConfiguration.DeliveryUri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeliveryUri.
The destination to send the campaign or treatment to. This value can be one of the following:
The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Lambda function to invoke to handle delivery of the campaign or treatment.
The URL for a web application or service that supports HTTPS and can receive the message. The URL has to be a full URL, including the HTTPS protocol.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CustomDeliveryConfiguration.EndpointTypes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointTypes.
The types of endpoints to send the campaign or treatment to. Each valid value maps to a type of channel that you can associate with an endpoint by using the ChannelType property of an endpoint.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CustomMessageActivity
member.summary: The settings for a custom message activity. This type of activity calls an AWS Lambda function or web hook that sends messages to participants.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CustomMessageActivity.DeliveryUri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeliveryUri.
The destination to send the campaign or treatment to. This value can be one of the following:
The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Lambda function to invoke to handle delivery of the campaign or treatment.
The URL for a web application or service that supports HTTPS and can receive the message. The URL has to be a full URL, including the HTTPS protocol.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CustomMessageActivity.EndpointTypes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointTypes.
The types of endpoints to send the custom message to. Each valid value maps to a type of channel that you can associate with an endpoint by using the ChannelType property of an endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CustomMessageActivity.MessageConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MessageConfig.
Specifies the message data included in a custom channel message that's sent to participants in a journey.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CustomMessageActivity.NextActivity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextActivity.
The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after Amazon Pinpoint calls the AWS Lambda function or web hook.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CustomMessageActivity.TemplateName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TemplateName.
The name of the custom message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the name of an existing message template.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.CustomMessageActivity.TemplateVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TemplateVersion.
The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses the active version of the template. The active version is typically the version of a template that's been most recently reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't necessarily the latest version of a template.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DefaultMessage
member.summary: Specifies the default message for all channels.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DefaultMessage.Body
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Body.
The default body of the message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DefaultMessage.Substitutions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Substitutions.
The default message variables to use in the message. You can override these default variables with individual address variables.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DefaultPushNotificationMessage
member.summary: Specifies the default settings and content for a push notification that's sent directly to an endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DefaultPushNotificationMessage.Action
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Action.
The default action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of the iOS and Android platforms.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DefaultPushNotificationMessage.Body
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Body.
The default body of the notification message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DefaultPushNotificationMessage.Data
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Data.
The JSON data payload to use for the default push notification, if the notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DefaultPushNotificationMessage.SilentPush
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SilentPush.
Specifies whether the default notification is a silent push notification, which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as updating an app's configuration or delivering messages to an in-app notification center.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DefaultPushNotificationMessage.Substitutions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Substitutions.
The default message variables to use in the notification message. You can override the default variables with individual address variables.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DefaultPushNotificationMessage.Title
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Title.
The default title to display above the notification message on a recipient's device.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DefaultPushNotificationMessage.Url
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Url.
The default URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DefaultPushNotificationTemplate
member.summary: Specifies the default settings and content for a message template that can be used in messages that are sent through a push notification channel.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DefaultPushNotificationTemplate.Action
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Action.
The action to occur if a recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message template. Valid values are:
OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of the iOS and Android platforms.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DefaultPushNotificationTemplate.Body
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Body.
The message body to use in push notifications that are based on the message template.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DefaultPushNotificationTemplate.Sound
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Sound.
The sound to play when a recipient receives a push notification that's based on the message template. You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a sound resource that's bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound file must reside in /res/raw/.
For an iOS platform, this value is the key for the name of a sound file in your app's main bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your app's data container. If the sound file can't be found or you specify default for the value, the system plays the default alert sound.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DefaultPushNotificationTemplate.Title
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Title.
The title to use in push notifications that are based on the message template. This title appears above the notification message on a recipient's device.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DefaultPushNotificationTemplate.Url
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Url.
The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message template and the value of the Action property is URL.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DeleteEmailTemplateRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteEmailTemplate operation. Deletes a message template for messages that were sent through the email channel.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DeleteEmailTemplateRequest.TemplateName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TemplateName.
The name of the message template. A template name must start with an alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters. The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DeleteEmailTemplateRequest.Version
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Version.
The unique identifier for the version of the message template to update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers and other information for all the versions of a template, use the Template Versions resource.
If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. If specified for an update operation, this value must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don't occur.
If you don't specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does the following:
For a get operation, retrieves information about the active version of the template.
For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version parameter isn't used or is set to false.
For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all versions of the template.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DeleteEmailTemplateResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteEmailTemplate operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DeleteEmailTemplateResponse.MessageBody
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MessageBody.

member.summary:

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property APNSMessage.

member.summary:

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DirectMessageConfiguration.EmailMessage
member.summary:

The default message for the email channel. This message overrides the default message (DefaultMessage).

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.DirectMessageConfiguration.SMSMessage

The default message for the voice channel. This message overrides the default message (DefaultMessage).

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailChannelResponse.FromAddress

The verified email address that email is sent from when you send email through the channel.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailMessage

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailMessage.Body
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Body.
The body of the email message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailMessage.FeedbackForwardingAddress
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FeedbackForwardingAddress.
The email address to forward bounces and complaints to, if feedback forwarding is enabled.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailMessage.FromAddress
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FromAddress.
The verified email address to send the email message from. The default value is the FromAddress specified for the email channel.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailMessage.RawEmail
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RawEmail.
The email message, represented as a raw MIME message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailMessage.ReplyToAddresses
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplyToAddresses.
The reply-to email address(es) for the email message. If a recipient replies to the email, each reply-to address receives the reply.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailMessage.SimpleEmail
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SimpleEmail.
The email message, composed of a subject, a text part, and an HTML part.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailMessage.Substitutions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Substitutions.
The default message variables to use in the email message. You can override the default variables with individual address variables.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailMessageActivity
member.summary: Specifies the settings for an email activity in a journey. This type of activity sends an email message to participants.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailMessageActivity.MessageConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MessageConfig.
Specifies the sender address for an email message that's sent to participants in the journey.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailMessageActivity.NextActivity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextActivity.
The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after the message is sent.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailMessageActivity.TemplateName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TemplateName.
The name of the email message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the name of an existing message template.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailMessageActivity.TemplateVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TemplateVersion.
The unique identifier for the version of the email template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses the active version of the template. The active version is typically the version of a template that's been most recently reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't necessarily the latest version of a template.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailTemplateRequest
member.summary: Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be used in messages that are sent through the email channel.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailTemplateRequest.DefaultSubstitutions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultSubstitutions.
A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When you create a message that's based on the template, you can override these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables and values.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailTemplateRequest.HtmlPart
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HtmlPart.
The message body, in HTML format, to use in email messages that are based on the message template. We recommend using HTML format for email clients that render HTML content. You can include links, formatted text, and more in an HTML message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailTemplateRequest.RecommenderId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommenderId.
The unique identifier for the recommender model to use for the message template. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to determine how to retrieve and process data from a recommender model when it sends messages that use the template, if the template contains message variables for recommendation data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailTemplateRequest.Subject
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subject.
The subject line, or title, to use in email messages that are based on the message template.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailTemplateRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailTemplateRequest.TemplateDescription
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TemplateDescription.
A custom description of the message template.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EmailTemplateRequest.TextPart
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TextPart.
The message body, in plain text format, to use in email messages that are based on the message template. We recommend using plain text format for email clients that don't render HTML content and clients that are connected to high-latency networks, such as mobile devices.

member.summary:

The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for message variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointBatchItem
member.summary: Specifies an endpoint to create or update and the settings and attributes to set or change for the endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointBatchItem.Address
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Address.
The destination address for messages or push notifications that you send to the endpoint. The address varies by channel. For a push-notification channel, use the token provided by the push notification service, such as an Apple Push Notification service (APNs) device token or a Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) registration token. For the SMS channel, use a phone number in E.164 format, such as +12065550100. For the email channel, use an email address.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointBatchItem.Attributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attributes.
One or more custom attributes that describe the endpoint by associating a name with an array of values. For example, the value of a custom attribute named Interests might be: ["Science", "Music", "Travel"]. You can use these attributes as filter criteria when you create segments. Attribute names are case sensitive.
An attribute name can contain up to 50 characters. An attribute value can contain up to 100 characters. When you define the name of a custom attribute, avoid using the following characters: number sign (#), colon (:), question mark (?), backslash (\), and slash (/). The Amazon Pinpoint console can't display attribute names that contain these characters. This restriction doesn't apply to attribute values.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointBatchItem.ChannelType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelType.
The channel to use when sending messages or push notifications to the endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointBatchItem.Demographic
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Demographic.
The demographic information for the endpoint, such as the time zone and platform.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointBatchItem.EffectiveDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EffectiveDate.
The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the endpoint was created or updated.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointBatchItem.EndpointStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointStatus.
Specifies whether to send messages or push notifications to the endpoint. Valid values are: ACTIVE, messages are sent to the endpoint; and, INACTIVE, messages aren’t sent to the endpoint.
Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to ACTIVE when you create an endpoint or update an existing endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to INACTIVE if you update another endpoint that has the same address specified by the Address property.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointBatchItem.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier for the endpoint in the context of the batch.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointBatchItem.Location
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Location.
The geographic information for the endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointBatchItem.Metrics
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Metrics.
One or more custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint for the endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointBatchItem.OptOut
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OptOut.
Specifies whether the user who's associated with the endpoint has opted out of receiving messages and push notifications from you. Possible values are: ALL, the user has opted out and doesn't want to receive any messages or push notifications; and, NONE, the user hasn't opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointBatchItem.RequestId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RequestId.
The unique identifier for the request to create or update the endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointBatchItem.User
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property User.
One or more custom attributes that describe the user who's associated with the endpoint.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointMessageResult
member.summary: Provides information about the delivery status and results of sending a message directly to an endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointMessageResult.Address
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Address.
The endpoint address that the message was delivered to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointMessageResult.DeliveryStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeliveryStatus.
The delivery status of the message. Possible values are:
DUPLICATE - The endpoint address is a duplicate of another endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message again.
OPT_OUT - The user who's associated with the endpoint has opted out of receiving messages from you. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message again.
PERMANENT_FAILURE - An error occurred when delivering the message to the endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message again.
SUCCESSFUL - The message was successfully delivered to the endpoint.
TEMPORARY_FAILURE - A temporary error occurred. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message again.
THROTTLED - Amazon Pinpoint throttled the operation to send the message to the endpoint.
TIMEOUT - The message couldn't be sent within the timeout period.
UNKNOWN_FAILURE - An unknown error occurred.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointMessageResult.MessageId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MessageId.
The unique identifier for the message that was sent.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointMessageResult.StatusCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StatusCode.
The downstream service status code for delivering the message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointMessageResult.StatusMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StatusMessage.
The status message for delivering the message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointMessageResult.UpdatedToken
member.summary:

For push notifications that are sent through the GCM channel, specifies whether the endpoint's device registration token was updated as part of delivering the message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointResponse.CohortId
member.summary:

A number from 0-99 that represents the cohort that the endpoint is assigned to. Endpoints are grouped into cohorts randomly, and each cohort contains approximately 1 percent of the endpoints for an application. Amazon Pinpoint assigns cohorts to the holdout or treatment allocations for campaigns.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointSendConfiguration.Context
member.summary:

For a push notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint object. For an email or text message, this payload is added to email/SMS delivery receipt event attributes.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointSendConfiguration.RawContent
member.summary:

The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the message. If specified, this value overrides all other values for the message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointSendConfiguration.Substitutions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Substitutions.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EndpointSendConfiguration.TitleOverride
member.summary:

The title or subject line of the message. If specified, this value overrides the default message title or subject line.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventDimensions
member.summary: Specifies the dimensions for an event filter that determines when a campaign is sent or a journey activity is performed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventDimensions.Attributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attributes.
One or more custom attributes that your application reports to Amazon Pinpoint. You can use these attributes as selection criteria when you create an event filter.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventDimensions.EventType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventType.
The name of the event that causes the campaign to be sent or the journey activity to be performed. This can be a standard event that Amazon Pinpoint generates, such as _email.delivered. For campaigns, this can also be a custom event that's specific to your application. For information about standard events, see Streaming Amazon Pinpoint Events in the Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventDimensions.Metrics
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Metrics.
One or more custom metrics that your application reports to Amazon Pinpoint. You can use these metrics as selection criteria when you create an event filter.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventFilter
member.summary: Specifies the settings for an event that causes a campaign to be sent or a journey activity to be performed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventFilter.Dimensions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Dimensions.
The dimensions for the event filter to use for the campaign or the journey activity.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventFilter.FilterType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterType.
The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent or the journey activity to be performed. Valid values are: SYSTEM, sends the campaign or performs the activity when a system event occurs; and, ENDPOINT, sends the campaign or performs the activity when an endpoint event (Events resource) occurs.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventItemResponse
member.summary: Provides the status code and message that result from processing an event.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventItemResponse.Message
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Message.
A custom message that's returned in the response as a result of processing the event.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventItemResponse.StatusCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StatusCode.
The status code that's returned in the response as a result of processing the event. Possible values are: 202, for events that were accepted; and, 400, for events that weren't valid.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventsBatch
member.summary: Specifies a batch of endpoints and events to process.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventsBatch.Endpoint
member.summary:

A set of properties and attributes that are associated with the endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventsBatch.Events

A set of properties that are associated with the event.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventsRequest
member.summary: Specifies a batch of events to process.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventsRequest.BatchItem
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BatchItem.
The batch of events to process. For each item in a batch, the endpoint ID acts as a key that has an EventsBatch object as its value.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventsResponse
member.summary: Provides information about endpoints and the events that they're associated with.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventsResponse.Results
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Results.
A map that contains a multipart response for each endpoint. For each item in this object, the endpoint ID is the key and the item response is the value. If no item response exists, the value can also be one of the following: 202, the request was processed successfully; or 400, the payload wasn't valid or required fields were missing.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventStartCondition

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventStream
member.summary: Specifies settings for publishing event data to an Amazon Kinesis data stream or an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventStream.ApplicationId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ApplicationId.
The unique identifier for the application to publish event data for.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventStream.DestinationStreamArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DestinationStreamArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis data stream or Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream to publish event data to.
For a Kinesis data stream, the ARN format is: arn:aws:kinesis:region:account-id:stream/stream_name
For a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream, the ARN format is: arn:aws:firehose:region:account-id:deliverystream/stream_name

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventStream.ExternalId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExternalId.
(Deprecated) Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to an external ID key in an IAM trust policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value to assume an IAM role when publishing event data, but we removed this requirement. We don't recommend use of external IDs for IAM roles that are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventStream.LastModifiedDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastModifiedDate.
The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the event stream was last modified.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventStream.LastUpdatedBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastUpdatedBy.
The IAM user who last modified the event stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.EventStream.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to publish event data to the stream in your AWS account.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobRequest
member.summary: Specifies the settings for a job that exports endpoint definitions to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobRequest.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to access the Amazon S3 location where you want to export endpoint definitions to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobRequest.S3UrlPrefix
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3UrlPrefix.
The URL of the location in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket where you want to export endpoint definitions to. This location is typically a folder that contains multiple files. The URL should be in the following format: s3://bucket-name/folder-name/.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobRequest.SegmentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SegmentId.
The identifier for the segment to export endpoint definitions from. If you don't specify this value, Amazon Pinpoint exports definitions for all the endpoints that are associated with the application.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobRequest.SegmentVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SegmentVersion.
The version of the segment to export endpoint definitions from, if specified.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobResource
member.summary: Provides information about the resource settings for a job that exports endpoint definitions to a file. The file can be added directly to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket by using the Amazon Pinpoint API or downloaded directly to a computer by using the Amazon Pinpoint console.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobResource.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorized Amazon Pinpoint to access the Amazon S3 location where the endpoint definitions were exported to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobResource.S3UrlPrefix
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3UrlPrefix.
The URL of the location in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket where the endpoint definitions were exported to. This location is typically a folder that contains multiple files. The URL should be in the following format: s3://bucket-name/folder-name/.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobResource.SegmentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SegmentId.
The identifier for the segment that the endpoint definitions were exported from. If this value isn't present, Amazon Pinpoint exported definitions for all the endpoints that are associated with the application.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobResource.SegmentVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SegmentVersion.
The version of the segment that the endpoint definitions were exported from.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobResponse
member.summary: Provides information about the status and settings of a job that exports endpoint definitions to a file. member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobResponse.ApplicationId
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobResponse.CompletedPieces
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobResponse.CompletionDate
member.summary:

The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the export job was completed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobResponse.CreationDate
member.summary:

The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the export job was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobResponse.Definition
member.summary:

The resource settings that apply to the export job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobResponse.FailedPieces
member.summary:

The number of pieces that weren't processed successfully (failed) by the export job, as of the time of the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobResponse.Failures
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Failures.
An array of entries, one for each of the first 100 entries that weren't processed successfully (failed) by the export job, if any.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier for the export job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobResponse.JobStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobStatus.
The status of the export job. The job status is FAILED if Amazon Pinpoint wasn't able to process one or more pieces in the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobResponse.TotalFailures
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalFailures.
The total number of endpoint definitions that weren't processed successfully (failed) by the export job, typically because an error, such as a syntax error, occurred.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobResponse.TotalPieces
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalPieces.
The total number of pieces that must be processed to complete the export job. Each piece consists of an approximately equal portion of the endpoint definitions that are part of the export job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobResponse.TotalProcessed
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalProcessed.
The total number of endpoint definitions that were processed by the export job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobResponse.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The job type. This value is EXPORT for export jobs.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobsResponse
member.summary: Provides information about all the export jobs that are associated with an application or segment. An export job is a job that exports endpoint definitions to a file.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ExportJobsResponse.Item
member.summary:

An array of responses, one for each export job that's associated with the application (Export Jobs resource) or segment (Segment Export Jobs resource).

member.summary:

The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.

member.summary:

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMChannelResponse
member.summary: Provides information about the status and settings of the GCM channel for an application. The GCM channel enables Amazon Pinpoint to send push notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMChannelResponse.ApplicationId
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMChannelResponse.CreationDate

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMChannelResponse.Credential
member.summary:

The Web API Key, also referred to as an API_KEY or server key, that you received from Google to communicate with Google services.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMChannelResponse.Enabled
member.summary:

Specifies whether the GCM channel is enabled for the application.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMChannelResponse.HasCredential
member.summary:

(Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMChannelResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
