member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMChannelResponse.IsArchived
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IsArchived.
Specifies whether the GCM channel is archived.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMChannelResponse.LastModifiedBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastModifiedBy.
The user who last modified the GCM channel.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMChannelResponse.LastModifiedDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastModifiedDate.
The date and time when the GCM channel was last modified.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMChannelResponse.Platform
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Platform.
The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For the GCM channel, this value is GCM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMChannelResponse.Version
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Version.
The current version of the GCM channel.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMMessage
member.summary: Specifies the settings for a one-time message that's sent directly to an endpoint through the GCM channel. The GCM channel enables Amazon Pinpoint to send messages to the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMMessage.Action
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Action.
The action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of the Android platform.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMMessage.Body
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Body.
The body of the notification message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMMessage.CollapseKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CollapseKey.
An arbitrary string that identifies a group of messages that can be collapsed to ensure that only the last message is sent when delivery can resume. This helps avoid sending too many instances of the same messages when the recipient's device comes online again or becomes active.
Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) collapse_key parameter when it sends the notification message to FCM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMMessage.Data
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Data.
The JSON data payload to use for the push notification, if the notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMMessage.IconReference
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IconReference.
The icon image name of the asset saved in your app.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMMessage.ImageIconUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageIconUrl.
The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of the push notification.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMMessage.ImageUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageUrl.
The URL of an image to display in the push notification.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMMessage.Priority
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Priority.
para>normal - The notification might be delayed. Delivery is optimized for battery usage on the recipient's device. Use this value unless immediate delivery is required.
/listitem>
high - The notification is sent immediately and might wake a sleeping device.
/para>
Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the FCM priority parameter when it sends the notification message to FCM.
The equivalent values for Apple Push Notification service (APNs) are 5, for normal, and 10, for high. If you specify an APNs value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint accepts and converts the value to the corresponding FCM value.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMMessage.RawContent
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RawContent.
The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMMessage.RestrictedPackageName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestrictedPackageName.
The package name of the application where registration tokens must match in order for the recipient to receive the message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMMessage.SilentPush
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SilentPush.
Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification, which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as updating an app's configuration or supporting phone home functionality.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMMessage.SmallImageIconUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SmallImageIconUrl.
The URL of the small icon image to display in the status bar and the content view of the push notification.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMMessage.Sound
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Sound.
The sound to play when the recipient receives the push notification. You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a sound resource that's bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound file must reside in /res/raw/.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMMessage.Substitutions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Substitutions.
The default message variables to use in the notification message. You can override the default variables with individual address variables.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMMessage.TimeToLive
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimeToLive.
The amount of time, in seconds, that FCM should store and attempt to deliver the push notification, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the first time. If you don't specify this value, FCM defaults to the maximum value, which is 2,419,200 seconds (28 days).
Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the FCM time_to_live parameter when it sends the notification message to FCM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMMessage.Title
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Title.
The title to display above the notification message on the recipient's device.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GCMMessage.Url
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Url.
The URL to open in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GetApplicationDateRangeKpiRequest.ApplicationId
member.summary:

The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the Project ID on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GetApplicationDateRangeKpiRequest.EndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndTime.
The last date and time to retrieve data for, as part of an inclusive date range that filters the query results. This value should be in extended ISO 8601 format and use Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), for example: 2019-07-26T20:00:00Z for 8:00 PM UTC July 26, 2019.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GetApplicationDateRangeKpiRequest.KpiName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KpiName.
The name of the metric, also referred to as a key performance indicator (KPI), to retrieve data for. This value describes the associated metric and consists of two or more terms, which are comprised of lowercase alphanumeric characters, separated by a hyphen. Examples are email-open-rate and successful-delivery-rate. For a list of valid values, see the Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GetApplicationDateRangeKpiRequest.NextToken
member.summary:

The string that specifies which page of results to return in a paginated response. This parameter is not supported for application, campaign, and journey metrics.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GetApplicationDateRangeKpiRequest.PageSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PageSize.
The maximum number of items to include in each page of a paginated response. This parameter is not supported for application, campaign, and journey metrics.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GetApplicationDateRangeKpiRequest.StartTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartTime.
The first date and time to retrieve data for, as part of an inclusive date range that filters the query results. This value should be in extended ISO 8601 format and use Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), for example: 2019-07-19T20:00:00Z for 8:00 PM UTC July 19, 2019. This value should also be fewer than 90 days from the current day.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GetCampaignDateRangeKpiRequest.KpiName
member.summary:

The name of the metric, also referred to as a key performance indicator (KPI), to retrieve data for. This value describes the associated metric and consists of two or more terms, which are comprised of lowercase alphanumeric characters, separated by a hyphen. Examples are email-open-rate and successful-delivery-rate. For a list of valid values, see the Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide.

The first date and time to retrieve data for, as part of an inclusive date range that filters the query results. This value should be in extended ISO 8601 format and use Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), for example: 2019-07-19T20:00:00Z for 8:00 PM UTC July 19, 2019. member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GetEmailTemplateRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetEmailTemplate operation. Retrieves the content and settings of a message template for messages that are sent through the email channel.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GetEmailTemplateRequest.TemplateName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TemplateName.
The name of the message template. A template name must start with an alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters. The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GetEmailTemplateRequest.Version
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Version.
The unique identifier for the version of the message template to update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers and other information for all the versions of a template, use the Template Versions resource.
If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. If specified for an update operation, this value must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don't occur.
If you don't specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does the following:
For a get operation, retrieves information about the active version of the template.
For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version parameter isn't used or is set to false.
For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all versions of the template.

member.summary: This is the response object from the GetEmailTemplate operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GetPushTemplateRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetPushTemplate operation. Retrieves the content and settings of a message template for messages that are sent through a push notification channel.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GetPushTemplateRequest.TemplateName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TemplateName.
The name of the message template. A template name must start with an alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters. The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.GetPushTemplateRequest.Version
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Version.
The unique identifier for the version of the message template to update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers and other information for all the versions of a template, use the Template Versions resource.
If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. If specified for an update operation, this value must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don't occur.
If you don't specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does the following:
For a get operation, retrieves information about the active version of the template.
For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version parameter isn't used or is set to false.
For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all versions of the template.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.HoldoutActivity
member.summary: Specifies the settings for a holdout activity in a journey. This type of activity stops a journey for a specified percentage of participants.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.HoldoutActivity.NextActivity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextActivity.
The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after performing the holdout activity.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.HoldoutActivity.Percentage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Percentage.
The percentage of participants who shouldn't continue the journey.
To determine which participants are held out, Amazon Pinpoint applies a probability-based algorithm to the percentage that you specify. Therefore, the actual percentage of participants who are held out may not be equal to the percentage that you specify.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobRequest
member.summary: Specifies the settings for a job that imports endpoint definitions from an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobRequest.DefineSegment
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefineSegment.
Specifies whether to create a segment that contains the endpoints, when the endpoint definitions are imported.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobRequest.ExternalId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExternalId.
(Deprecated) Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to an external ID key in an IAM trust policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value to assume an IAM role when importing endpoint definitions, but we removed this requirement. We don't recommend use of external IDs for IAM roles that are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobRequest.Format
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Format.
The format of the files that contain the endpoint definitions to import. Valid values are: CSV, for comma-separated values format; and, JSON, for newline-delimited JSON format. If the Amazon S3 location stores multiple files that use different formats, Amazon Pinpoint imports data only from the files that use the specified format.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobRequest.RegisterEndpoints
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegisterEndpoints.
Specifies whether to register the endpoints with Amazon Pinpoint, when the endpoint definitions are imported.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobRequest.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to access the Amazon S3 location to import endpoint definitions from.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobRequest.S3Url
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Url.
The URL of the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket that contains the endpoint definitions to import. This location can be a folder or a single file. If the location is a folder, Amazon Pinpoint imports endpoint definitions from the files in this location, including any subfolders that the folder contains.
The URL should be in the following format: s3://bucket-name/folder-name/file-name. The location can end with the key for an individual object or a prefix that qualifies multiple objects.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobRequest.SegmentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SegmentId.
The identifier for the segment to update or add the imported endpoint definitions to, if the import job is meant to update an existing segment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobRequest.SegmentName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SegmentName.
A custom name for the segment that's created by the import job, if the value of the DefineSegment property is true.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResource
member.summary: Provides information about the resource settings for a job that imports endpoint definitions from one or more files. The files can be stored in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket or uploaded directly from a computer by using the Amazon Pinpoint console.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResource.DefineSegment
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefineSegment.
Specifies whether the import job creates a segment that contains the endpoints, when the endpoint definitions are imported.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResource.ExternalId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExternalId.
(Deprecated) Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to an external ID key in an IAM trust policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value to assume an IAM role when importing endpoint definitions, but we removed this requirement. We don't recommend use of external IDs for IAM roles that are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResource.Format
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Format.
The format of the files that contain the endpoint definitions to import. Valid values are: CSV, for comma-separated values format; and, JSON, for newline-delimited JSON format.
If the files are stored in an Amazon S3 location and that location contains multiple files that use different formats, Amazon Pinpoint imports data only from the files that use the specified format.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResource.RegisterEndpoints
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegisterEndpoints.
Specifies whether the import job registers the endpoints with Amazon Pinpoint, when the endpoint definitions are imported.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResource.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to access the Amazon S3 location to import endpoint definitions from.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResource.S3Url
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Url.
The URL of the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket that contains the endpoint definitions to import. This location can be a folder or a single file. If the location is a folder, Amazon Pinpoint imports endpoint definitions from the files in this location, including any subfolders that the folder contains.
The URL should be in the following format: s3://bucket-name/folder-name/file-name. The location can end with the key for an individual object or a prefix that qualifies multiple objects.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResource.SegmentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SegmentId.
The identifier for the segment that the import job updates or adds endpoint definitions to, if the import job updates an existing segment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResource.SegmentName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SegmentName.
The custom name for the segment that's created by the import job, if the value of the DefineSegment property is true.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResponse
member.summary: Provides information about the status and settings of a job that imports endpoint definitions from one or more files. The files can be stored in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket or uploaded directly from a computer by using the Amazon Pinpoint console.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResponse.ApplicationId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ApplicationId.
The unique identifier for the application that's associated with the import job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResponse.CompletedPieces
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CompletedPieces.
The number of pieces that were processed successfully (completed) by the import job, as of the time of the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResponse.CompletionDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CompletionDate.
The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the import job was completed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResponse.CreationDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationDate.
The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the import job was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResponse.Definition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Definition.
The resource settings that apply to the import job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResponse.FailedPieces
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FailedPieces.
The number of pieces that weren't processed successfully (failed) by the import job, as of the time of the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResponse.Failures
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Failures.
An array of entries, one for each of the first 100 entries that weren't processed successfully (failed) by the import job, if any.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier for the import job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResponse.JobStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobStatus.
The status of the import job. The job status is FAILED if Amazon Pinpoint wasn't able to process one or more pieces in the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResponse.TotalFailures
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalFailures.
The total number of endpoint definitions that weren't processed successfully (failed) by the import job, typically because an error, such as a syntax error, occurred.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResponse.TotalPieces
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalPieces.
The total number of pieces that must be processed to complete the import job. Each piece consists of an approximately equal portion of the endpoint definitions that are part of the import job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResponse.TotalProcessed
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalProcessed.
The total number of endpoint definitions that were processed by the import job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobResponse.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The job type. This value is IMPORT for import jobs.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobsResponse
member.summary: Provides information about the status and settings of all the import jobs that are associated with an application or segment. An import job is a job that imports endpoint definitions from one or more files.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobsResponse.Item
member.summary:

An array of responses, one for each import job that's associated with the application (Import Jobs resource) or segment (Segment Import Jobs resource).

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ImportJobsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse
member.summary: Provides the results of a query that retrieved the data for a standard execution metric that applies to a journey activity, and provides information about that query.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse.ActivityType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ActivityType.
The type of activity that the metric applies to. Possible values are:
CONDITIONAL_SPLIT - For a yes/no split activity, which is an activity that sends participants down one of two paths in a journey.
HOLDOUT - For a holdout activity, which is an activity that stops a journey for a specified percentage of participants.
MESSAGE - For an email activity, which is an activity that sends an email message to participants.
MULTI_CONDITIONAL_SPLIT - For a multivariate split activity, which is an activity that sends participants down one of as many as five paths in a journey.
RANDOM_SPLIT - For a random split activity, which is an activity that sends specified percentages of participants down one of as many as five paths in a journey.
WAIT - For a wait activity, which is an activity that waits for a certain amount of time or until a specific date and time before moving participants to the next activity in a journey.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse.ApplicationId
member.summary:

The unique identifier for the application that the metric applies to.

member.summary:

The unique identifier for the activity that the metric applies to.

member.summary:

member.summary:

The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Pinpoint last evaluated the execution status of the activity and updated the data for the metric.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyLimits
member.summary: Specifies limits on the messages that a journey can send and the number of times participants can enter a journey.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyLimits.DailyCap
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DailyCap.
The maximum number of messages that the journey can send to a single participant during a 24-hour period. The maximum value is 100.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyLimits.EndpointReentryCap
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointReentryCap.
The maximum number of times that a participant can enter the journey. The maximum value is 100. To allow participants to enter the journey an unlimited number of times, set this value to 0.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyLimits.EndpointReentryInterval
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointReentryInterval.
Minimum time that must pass before an endpoint can re-enter a given journey. The duration should use an ISO 8601 format, such as PT1H.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyLimits.MessagesPerSecond
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MessagesPerSecond.
The maximum number of messages that the journey can send each second.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyPushMessage
member.summary: Specifies the message configuration for a push notification that's sent to participants in a journey.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyPushMessage.TimeToLive
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimeToLive.
The number of seconds that the push notification service should keep the message, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the first time. This value is converted to an expiration value when it's sent to a push-notification service. If this value is 0, the service treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service doesn't store or try to deliver the notification again.
This value doesn't apply to messages that are sent through the Amazon Device Messaging (ADM) service.

member.summary:

The messaging and entry limits for the journey.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyResponse.LocalTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocalTime.
Specifies whether the journey's scheduled start and end times use each participant's local time. If this value is true, the schedule uses each participant's local time.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyResponse.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the journey.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyResponse.QuietTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QuietTime.
The quiet time settings for the journey. Quiet time is a specific time range when a journey doesn't send messages to participants, if all the following conditions are met:
The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint for the participant is set to a valid value.
The current time in the participant's time zone is later than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the journey.
The current time in the participant's time zone is earlier than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the journey.
If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the participant will receive messages from the journey, even if quiet time is enabled.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyResponse.RefreshFrequency
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RefreshFrequency.
The frequency with which Amazon Pinpoint evaluates segment and event data for the journey, as a duration in ISO 8601 format.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyResponse.RefreshOnSegmentUpdate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RefreshOnSegmentUpdate.
Specifies whether a journey should be refreshed on segment update.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyResponse.Schedule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Schedule.
The schedule settings for the journey.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyResponse.StartActivity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartActivity.
The unique identifier for the first activity in the journey.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyResponse.StartCondition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartCondition.
The segment that defines which users are participants in the journey.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyResponse.State
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property State.
The current status of the journey. Possible values are:
DRAFT - The journey is being developed and hasn't been published yet.
ACTIVE - The journey has been developed and published. Depending on the journey's schedule, the journey may currently be running or scheduled to start running at a later time. If a journey's status is ACTIVE, you can't add, change, or remove activities from it.
COMPLETED - The journey has been published and has finished running. All participants have entered the journey and no participants are waiting to complete the journey or any activities in the journey.
CANCELLED - The journey has been stopped. If a journey's status is CANCELLED, you can't add, change, or remove activities or segment settings from the journey.
CLOSED - The journey has been published and has started running. It may have also passed its scheduled end time, or passed its scheduled start time and a refresh frequency hasn't been specified for it. If a journey's status is CLOSED, you can't add participants to it, and no existing participants can enter the journey for the first time. However, any existing participants who are currently waiting to start an activity may continue the journey.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyResponse.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
This object is not used or supported.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyResponse.WaitForQuietTime
member.summary:

Specifies whether endpoints in quiet hours should enter a wait till the end of their quiet hours.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneySchedule

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneySchedule.StartTime

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneySchedule.Timezone
member.summary:

The starting UTC offset for the journey schedule, if the value of the journey's LocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC, UTC+01, UTC+02, UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05, UTC+05:30, UTC+05:45, UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+08:45, UTC+09, UTC+09:30, UTC+10, UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+12:45, UTC+13, UTC+13:45, UTC-02, UTC-02:30, UTC-03, UTC-03:30, UTC-04, UTC-05, UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-09:30, UTC-10, and UTC-11.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneySMSMessage

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneySMSMessage.EntityId
member.summary:

The entity ID or Principal Entity (PE) id received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in your country.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneySMSMessage.MessageType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MessageType.
The SMS message type. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages that are critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and PROMOTIONAL (for messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive, such as marketing messages).

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneySMSMessage.OriginationNumber
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OriginationNumber.
The long code to send the SMS message from. This value should be one of the dedicated long codes that's assigned to your AWS account. Although it isn't required, we recommend that you specify the long code using an E.164 format to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of the message. For example, +12065550100.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneySMSMessage.SenderId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SenderId.
The sender ID to display as the sender of the message on a recipient's device. Support for sender IDs varies by country or region. For more information, see Supported Countries and Regions in the Amazon Pinpoint User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneySMSMessage.TemplateId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TemplateId.
The template ID received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in your country.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneysResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyStateRequest
member.summary: Changes the status of a journey.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.JourneyStateRequest.State
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property State.
The status of the journey. Currently, Supported values are ACTIVE, PAUSED, and CANCELLED
If you cancel a journey, Amazon Pinpoint continues to perform activities that are currently in progress, until those activities are complete. Amazon Pinpoint also continues to collect and aggregate analytics data for those activities, until they are complete, and any activities that were complete when you cancelled the journey.
After you cancel a journey, you can't add, change, or remove any activities from the journey. In addition, Amazon Pinpoint stops evaluating the journey and doesn't perform any activities that haven't started.
When the journey is paused, Amazon Pinpoint continues to perform activities that are currently in progress, until those activities are complete. Endpoints will stop entering journeys when the journey is paused and will resume entering the journey after the journey is resumed. For wait activities, wait time is paused when the journey is paused. Currently, PAUSED only supports journeys with a segment refresh interval.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Message
member.summary: Specifies the content and settings for a push notification that's sent to recipients of a campaign.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Message.Action
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Action.
The action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of iOS and Android.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Message.Body
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Body.
The body of the notification message. The maximum number of characters is 200.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Message.ImageIconUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageIconUrl.
The URL of the image to display as the push-notification icon, such as the icon for the app.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Message.ImageSmallIconUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageSmallIconUrl.
The URL of the image to display as the small, push-notification icon, such as a small version of the icon for the app.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Message.ImageUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageUrl.
The URL of an image to display in the push notification.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Message.JsonBody
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JsonBody.
The JSON payload to use for a silent push notification.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Message.MediaUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MediaUrl.
The URL of the image or video to display in the push notification.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Message.RawContent
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RawContent.
The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Message.SilentPush
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SilentPush.
Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification, which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as updating an app's configuration, displaying messages in an in-app message center, or supporting phone home functionality.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Message.TimeToLive
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimeToLive.
The number of seconds that the push-notification service should keep the message, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the first time. This value is converted to an expiration value when it's sent to a push-notification service. If this value is 0, the service treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service doesn't store or try to deliver the notification again.
This value doesn't apply to messages that are sent through the Amazon Device Messaging (ADM) service.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Message.Title
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Title.
The title to display above the notification message on a recipient's device.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Message.Url
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Url.
The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.

member.summary: Specifies the configuration and other settings for a message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.MessageRequest.Addresses
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Addresses.
A map of key-value pairs, where each key is an address and each value is an AddressConfiguration object. An address can be a push notification token, a phone number, or an email address. You can use an AddressConfiguration object to tailor the message for an address by specifying settings such as content overrides and message variables.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.MessageRequest.Context
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Context.
A map of custom attributes to attach to the message. For a push notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint object. For an email or text message, this payload is added to email/SMS delivery receipt event attributes.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.MessageRequest.Endpoints
member.summary:

A map of key-value pairs, where each key is an endpoint ID and each value is an EndpointSendConfiguration object. You can use an EndpointSendConfiguration object to tailor the message for an endpoint by specifying settings such as content overrides and message variables.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.MessageRequest.MessageConfiguration
member.summary:

The settings and content for the default message and any default messages that you defined for specific channels.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.MessageResponse.RequestId
member.summary:

The identifier for the original request that the message was delivered for.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.MessageResponse.Result
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Result.
A map that contains a multipart response for each address (email address, phone number, or push notification token) that the message was sent to. In the map, the address is the key and the result is the value.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.MessageResult
member.summary: Provides information about the results of sending a message directly to an endpoint address.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.MessageResult.DeliveryStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeliveryStatus.
The delivery status of the message. Possible values are:
DUPLICATE - The endpoint address is a duplicate of another endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message again.
OPT_OUT - The user who's associated with the endpoint address has opted out of receiving messages from you. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message again.
PERMANENT_FAILURE - An error occurred when delivering the message to the endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message again.
SUCCESSFUL - The message was successfully delivered to the endpoint address.
TEMPORARY_FAILURE - A temporary error occurred. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message again.
THROTTLED - Amazon Pinpoint throttled the operation to send the message to the endpoint address.
TIMEOUT - The message couldn't be sent within the timeout period.
UNKNOWN_FAILURE - An unknown error occurred.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.MessageResult.MessageId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MessageId.
The unique identifier for the message that was sent.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.MessageResult.StatusCode
member.summary:

The downstream service status code for delivering the message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.MessageResult.StatusMessage
member.summary:

The status message for delivering the message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.MessageResult.UpdatedToken
member.summary:

For push notifications that are sent through the GCM channel, specifies whether the endpoint's device registration token was updated as part of delivering the message.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.MultiConditionalSplitActivity
member.summary:
Specifies the settings for a multivariate split activity in a journey. This type of activity sends participants down one of as many as five paths (including a default Else path) in a journey, based on conditions that you specify.
To create multivariate split activities that send participants down different paths based on push notification events (such as Open or Received events), your mobile app has to specify the User ID and Endpoint ID values. For more information, see Integrating Amazon Pinpoint with your application in the Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PublicEndpoint

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PublicEndpoint.Address
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Address.
The unique identifier for the recipient, such as a device token, email address, or mobile phone number.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PublicEndpoint.Attributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attributes.
One or more custom attributes that describe the endpoint by associating a name with an array of values. You can use these attributes as filter criteria when you create segments.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PublicEndpoint.ChannelType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelType.
The channel that's used when sending messages or push notifications to the endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PublicEndpoint.Demographic
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Demographic.
The demographic information for the endpoint, such as the time zone and platform.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PublicEndpoint.EffectiveDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EffectiveDate.
The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the endpoint was last updated.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PublicEndpoint.EndpointStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointStatus.
Specifies whether to send messages or push notifications to the endpoint. Valid values are: ACTIVE, messages are sent to the endpoint; and, INACTIVE, messages aren’t sent to the endpoint.
Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to ACTIVE when you create an endpoint or update an existing endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to INACTIVE if you update another endpoint that has the same address specified by the Address property.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PublicEndpoint.Location
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Location.
The geographic information for the endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PublicEndpoint.Metrics
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Metrics.
One or more custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint for the endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PublicEndpoint.OptOut
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OptOut.
Specifies whether the user who's associated with the endpoint has opted out of receiving messages and push notifications from you. Possible values are: ALL, the user has opted out and doesn't want to receive any messages or push notifications; and, NONE, the user hasn't opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PublicEndpoint.RequestId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RequestId.
A unique identifier that's generated each time the endpoint is updated.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PublicEndpoint.User
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property User.
One or more custom user attributes that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint for the user who's associated with the endpoint.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushMessageActivity
member.summary: Specifies the settings for a push notification activity in a journey. This type of activity sends a push notification to participants.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushMessageActivity.MessageConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MessageConfig.
Specifies the time to live (TTL) value for push notifications that are sent to participants in a journey.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushMessageActivity.NextActivity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextActivity.
The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after the message is sent.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushMessageActivity.TemplateName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TemplateName.
The name of the push notification template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the name of an existing message template.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushMessageActivity.TemplateVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TemplateVersion.
The unique identifier for the version of the push notification template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses the active version of the template. The active version is typically the version of a template that's been most recently reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't necessarily the latest version of a template.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateRequest
member.summary: Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be used in messages that are sent through a push notification channel.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateRequest.ADM
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ADM.
The message template to use for the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging) channel. This message template overrides the default template for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateRequest.APNS
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property APNS.
The message template to use for the APNs (Apple Push Notification service) channel. This message template overrides the default template for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateRequest.Baidu
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Baidu.
The message template to use for the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push) channel. This message template overrides the default template for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateRequest.Default
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Default.
The default message template to use for push notification channels.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateRequest.DefaultSubstitutions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultSubstitutions.
A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When you create a message that's based on the template, you can override these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables and values.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateRequest.GCM
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GCM.
The message template to use for the GCM channel, which is used to send notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. This message template overrides the default template for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateRequest.RecommenderId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommenderId.
The unique identifier for the recommender model to use for the message template. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to determine how to retrieve and process data from a recommender model when it sends messages that use the template, if the template contains message variables for recommendation data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateRequest.TemplateDescription
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TemplateDescription.
A custom description of the message template.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateResponse

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateResponse.ADM
member.summary:

The message template that's used for the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging) channel. This message template overrides the default template for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateResponse.APNS
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property APNS.
The message template that's used for the APNs (Apple Push Notification service) channel. This message template overrides the default template for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateResponse.Baidu
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Baidu.
The message template that's used for the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push) channel. This message template overrides the default template for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateResponse.CreationDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationDate.
The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateResponse.Default
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Default.
The default message template that's used for push notification channels.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateResponse.DefaultSubstitutions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultSubstitutions.
The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for message variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateResponse.GCM
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GCM.
The message template that's used for the GCM channel, which is used to send notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. This message template overrides the default template for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateResponse.LastModifiedDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastModifiedDate.
The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last modified.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateResponse.RecommenderId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommenderId.
The unique identifier for the recommender model that's used by the message template.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateResponse.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated with the message template. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateResponse.TemplateDescription
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TemplateDescription.
The custom description of the message template.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateResponse.TemplateName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TemplateName.
The name of the message template.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateResponse.TemplateType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TemplateType.
The type of channel that the message template is designed for. For a push notification template, this value is PUSH.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.PushNotificationTemplateResponse.Version
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Version.
The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the message template, or the version of the template that you specified by using the version parameter in your request.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.QuietTime
member.summary: Specifies the start and end times that define a time range when messages aren't sent to endpoints.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.QuietTime.End
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property End.
The specific time when quiet time ends. This value has to use 24-hour notation and be in HH:MM format, where HH is the hour (with a leading zero, if applicable) and MM is the minutes. For example, use 02:30 to represent 2:30 AM, or 14:30 to represent 2:30 PM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.QuietTime.Start
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Start.
The specific time when quiet time begins. This value has to use 24-hour notation and be in HH:MM format, where HH is the hour (with a leading zero, if applicable) and MM is the minutes. For example, use 02:30 to represent 2:30 AM, or 14:30 to represent 2:30 PM.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RandomSplitActivity
member.summary: Specifies the settings for a random split activity in a journey. This type of activity randomly sends specified percentages of participants down one of as many as five paths in a journey, based on conditions that you specify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RandomSplitActivity.Branches
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Branches.
The paths for the activity, including the percentage of participants to enter each path and the activity to perform for each path.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RandomSplitEntry
member.summary: Specifies the settings for a path in a random split activity in a journey.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RandomSplitEntry.NextActivity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextActivity.
The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after completing the activity for the path.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RandomSplitEntry.Percentage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Percentage.
The percentage of participants to send down the activity path.
To determine which participants are sent down each path, Amazon Pinpoint applies a probability-based algorithm to the percentages that you specify for the paths. Therefore, the actual percentage of participants who are sent down a path may not be equal to the percentage that you specify.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RawEmail
member.summary: Specifies the contents of an email message, represented as a raw MIME message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RawEmail.Data
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Data.
The email message, represented as a raw MIME message. The entire message must be base64 encoded.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RecencyDimension
member.summary: Specifies criteria for including or excluding endpoints from a segment based on how recently an endpoint was active.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RecencyDimension.Duration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Duration.
The duration to use when determining whether an endpoint is active or inactive.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RecencyDimension.RecencyType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecencyType.
The type of recency dimension to use for the segment. Valid values are: ACTIVE, endpoints that were active within the specified duration are included in the segment; and, INACTIVE, endpoints that weren't active within the specified duration are included in the segment.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RecommenderConfigurationResponse
member.summary: Provides information about Amazon Pinpoint configuration settings for retrieving and processing data from a recommender model.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RecommenderConfigurationResponse.Attributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attributes.
A map that defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user attributes, depending on the value for the RecommendationProviderIdType property. Each of these attributes temporarily stores a recommended item that's retrieved from the recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda function for additional processing. Each attribute can be used as a message variable in a message template.
This value is null if the configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of recommendation data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RecommenderConfigurationResponse.CreationDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationDate.
The date, in extended ISO 8601 format, when the configuration was created for the recommender model.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RecommenderConfigurationResponse.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The custom description of the configuration for the recommender model.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RecommenderConfigurationResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier for the recommender model configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RecommenderConfigurationResponse.LastModifiedDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastModifiedDate.
The date, in extended ISO 8601 format, when the configuration for the recommender model was last modified.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RecommenderConfigurationResponse.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The custom name of the configuration for the recommender model.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RecommenderConfigurationResponse.RecommendationProviderIdType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommendationProviderIdType.
The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID that's associated with unique user IDs in the recommender model. This value enables the model to use attribute and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or user in an Amazon Pinpoint application. Possible values are:
PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Each user in the model is associated with a particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.
PINPOINT_USER_ID - Each user in the model is associated with a particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If this value is specified, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify both a user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages won’t be sent to the user's endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RecommenderConfigurationResponse.RecommendationProviderRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommendationProviderRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve recommendation data from the recommender model.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RecommenderConfigurationResponse.RecommendationProviderUri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommendationProviderUri.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model that Amazon Pinpoint retrieves the recommendation data from. This value is the ARN of an Amazon Personalize campaign.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RecommenderConfigurationResponse.RecommendationsDisplayName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommendationsDisplayName.
The custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the RecommendationProviderIdType property. This name appears in the Attribute finder of the template editor on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
This value is null if the configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of recommendation data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RecommenderConfigurationResponse.RecommendationsPerMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommendationsPerMessage.
The number of recommended items that are retrieved from the model for each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the RecommendationProviderIdType property. This number determines how many recommended items are available for use in message variables.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RecommenderConfigurationResponse.RecommendationTransformerUri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommendationTransformerUri.
The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function that Amazon Pinpoint invokes to perform additional processing of recommendation data that it retrieves from the recommender model.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RemoveAttributesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the RemoveAttributes operation. Removes one or more attributes, of the same attribute type, from all the endpoints that are associated with an application.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RemoveAttributesRequest.ApplicationId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ApplicationId.
The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the Project ID on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RemoveAttributesRequest.AttributeType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttributeType.
The type of attribute or attributes to remove. Valid values are:
endpoint-custom-attributes - Custom attributes that describe endpoints, such as the date when an associated user opted in or out of receiving communications from you through a specific type of channel.
endpoint-metric-attributes - Custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint for endpoints, such as the number of app sessions or the number of items left in a cart.
endpoint-user-attributes - Custom attributes that describe users, such as first name, last name, and age.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RemoveAttributesRequest.UpdateAttributesRequest
member.summary: Gets and sets the property UpdateAttributesRequest.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RemoveAttributesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the RemoveAttributes operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.RemoveAttributesResponse.AttributesResource
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AttributesResource.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ResultRow
member.summary: Provides the results of a query that retrieved the data for a standard metric that applies to an application, campaign, or journey.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ResultRow.GroupedBys
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GroupedBys.
An array of objects that defines the field and field values that were used to group data in a result set that contains multiple results. This value is null if the data in a result set isn’t grouped.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ResultRow.Values
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Values.
An array of objects that provides pre-aggregated values for a standard metric that applies to an application, campaign, or journey.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ResultRowValue
member.summary: Provides a single value and metadata about that value as part of an array of query results for a standard metric that applies to an application, campaign, or journey.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ResultRowValue.Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Key.
The friendly name of the metric whose value is specified by the Value property.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ResultRowValue.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The data type of the value specified by the Value property.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.ResultRowValue.Value
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Value.
In a Values object, the value for the metric that the query retrieved data for. In a GroupedBys object, the value for the field that was used to group data in a result set that contains multiple results (Values objects).

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Schedule
member.summary: Specifies the schedule settings for a campaign.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Schedule.EndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndTime.
The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign ended or will end.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Schedule.EventFilter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventFilter.
The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent, if the value of the Frequency property is EVENT.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Schedule.Frequency
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Frequency.
Specifies how often the campaign is sent or whether the campaign is sent in response to a specific event.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Schedule.IsLocalTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IsLocalTime.
Specifies whether the start and end times for the campaign schedule use each recipient's local time. To base the schedule on each recipient's local time, set this value to true.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Schedule.QuietTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QuietTime.
The default quiet time for the campaign. Quiet time is a specific time range when a campaign doesn't send messages to endpoints, if all the following conditions are met:
The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set to a valid value.
The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the campaign.
The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the campaign.
If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will receive messages from the campaign, even if quiet time is enabled.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Schedule.StartTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartTime.
The scheduled time when the campaign began or will begin. Valid values are: IMMEDIATE, to start the campaign immediately; or, a specific time in ISO 8601 format.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.Schedule.Timezone
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Timezone.
The starting UTC offset for the campaign schedule, if the value of the IsLocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC, UTC+01, UTC+02, UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05, UTC+05:30, UTC+05:45, UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+09, UTC+09:30, UTC+10, UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+13, UTC-02, UTC-03, UTC-04, UTC-05, UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-10, and UTC-11.

The device model criteria for the segment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentDemographics.Platform

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attributes.
One or more custom attributes to use as criteria for the segment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentDimensions.Behavior
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Behavior.
The behavior-based criteria, such as how recently users have used your app, for the segment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentDimensions.Demographic
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Demographic.
The demographic-based criteria, such as device platform, for the segment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentDimensions.Location
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Location.
The location-based criteria, such as region or GPS coordinates, for the segment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentDimensions.Metrics
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Metrics.
One or more custom metrics to use as criteria for the segment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentDimensions.UserAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserAttributes.
One or more custom user attributes to use as criteria for the segment.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentGroup
member.summary: Specifies the base segments and dimensions for a segment, and the relationships between these base segments and dimensions.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentGroup.Dimensions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Dimensions.
An array that defines the dimensions for the segment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentGroup.SourceSegments
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceSegments.
The base segment to build the segment on. A base segment, also referred to as a source segment, defines the initial population of endpoints for a segment. When you add dimensions to a segment, Amazon Pinpoint filters the base segment by using the dimensions that you specify.
You can specify more than one dimensional segment or only one imported segment. If you specify an imported segment, the Amazon Pinpoint console displays a segment size estimate that indicates the size of the imported segment without any filters applied to it.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentGroup.SourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceType.
Specifies how to handle multiple base segments for the segment. For example, if you specify three base segments for the segment, whether the resulting segment is based on all, any, or none of the base segments.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentGroup.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
Specifies how to handle multiple dimensions for the segment. For example, if you specify three dimensions for the segment, whether the resulting segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of the dimensions.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentGroupList
member.summary: Specifies the settings that define the relationships between segment groups for a segment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentGroupList.Groups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Groups.
An array that defines the set of segment criteria to evaluate when handling segment groups for the segment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentGroupList.Include
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Include.
Specifies how to handle multiple segment groups for the segment. For example, if the segment includes three segment groups, whether the resulting segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of the segment groups.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentImportResource
member.summary: Provides information about the import job that created a segment. An import job is a job that creates a user segment by importing endpoint definitions.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentImportResource.ChannelCounts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelCounts.
The number of channel types in the endpoint definitions that were imported to create the segment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentImportResource.ExternalId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExternalId.
(Deprecated) Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to an external ID key in an IAM trust policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value to assume an IAM role when importing endpoint definitions, but we removed this requirement. We don't recommend use of external IDs for IAM roles that are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentImportResource.Format
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Format.
The format of the files that were imported to create the segment. Valid values are: CSV, for comma-separated values format; and, JSON, for newline-delimited JSON format.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentImportResource.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorized Amazon Pinpoint to access the Amazon S3 location to import endpoint definitions from.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentImportResource.S3Url
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Url.
The URL of the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket that the endpoint definitions were imported from to create the segment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentImportResource.Size
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Size.
The number of endpoint definitions that were imported successfully to create the segment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentLocation.Country
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentLocation.GPSPoint
member.summary:

The GPS location and range for the segment.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentReference.Version

member.summary:

The unique identifier for the application that the segment is associated with.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the segment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentResponse.CreationDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationDate.
The date and time when the segment was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentResponse.Dimensions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Dimensions.
The dimension settings for the segment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier for the segment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentResponse.ImportDefinition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImportDefinition.
The settings for the import job that's associated with the segment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentResponse.LastModifiedDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastModifiedDate.
The date and time when the segment was last modified.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentResponse.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the segment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentResponse.SegmentGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SegmentGroups.
A list of one or more segment groups that apply to the segment. Each segment group consists of zero or more base segments and the dimensions that are applied to those base segments.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentResponse.SegmentType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SegmentType.
The segment type. Valid values are:
DIMENSIONAL - A dynamic segment, which is a segment that uses selection criteria that you specify and is based on endpoint data that's reported by your app. Dynamic segments can change over time.
IMPORT - A static segment, which is a segment that uses selection criteria that you specify and is based on endpoint definitions that you import from a file. Imported segments are static; they don't change over time.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentResponse.Tags
member.summary:

A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated with the segment. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.

member.summary:

The version number of the segment.

An array of responses, one for each segment that's associated with the application (Segments resource) or each version of a segment that's associated with the application (Segment Versions resource).

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SegmentsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:

The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SendMessagesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the SendMessages operation. Creates and sends a direct message.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SendMessagesRequest.ApplicationId

member.name: P:Amazon.Pinpoint.Model.SMSMessageActivity.TemplateVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TemplateVersion.
The unique identifier for the version of the SMS template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses the active version of the template. The active version is typically the version of a template that's been most recently reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't necessarily the latest version of a template.
